channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024010498
item.description:
Report X-2024010498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE OVERGOODS SECTION ON BOXLINE 3 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE CORROSIVE LABEL ON BOX AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, TOOK DOWN TO THE PIT FOR FURTURE PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2024010451
item.description:
Report X-2024010451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon sending the package to Van Line 2 package handlers noticed a wet corner on the package. Van Line manager called for QA and they safely secured the leaking hazmat into the Hazmat cage for further inspection and processing. Upon inspecting the hazmat it was found that one of the bottles had a loose cap causing a slow leakage through the package. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap causing slow leakage. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: QA rep wore gloves and carefully secured the hazmat into a hazmat bin and brought it to the hazmat processing cage.

item.title: Report E-2023120477
item.description:
Report E-2023120477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-25
  • City: RAPHINE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RDX, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 25, 2023, at 1645 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX, LLC personnel in Raphine, Virginia regarding the release of approximately (5) gallon of Professional Wire Wheel Cleaner (Corrosive Liquid, Toxic, N.O.S. (UN2922, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drums. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, contractors confirmed the material and the amount of the release. Contractors were able to to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE, and the leaking drum's top was tighten and secured to be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
